title_full: CMOBCOST01-BP01 Store raw data in a scalable and cost-effective way
title: Store raw data in a scalable and cost-effective way
description: Use object storage with appropriate storage classes. Use Amazon S3 Standard for frequently accessed data and Amazon Glacier for archived data. Use Amazon S3 Intelligent-Tiering to automatically move data between storage classes. Use schema-on-read services like Amazon Athena to query data in native form. Use lifecycle policies to automate data movement. Consider DynamoDB DAX for caching or Amazon Timestream for time-series data.
outcome: Optimized storage costs through intelligent tiering and appropriate service selection

title_full: CMOBCOST01-BP02 Use data partitioning for optimize performance and scalability
title: Use data partitioning for optimize performance and scalability
description: Partition raw vehicle data by time, geography, or other factors to optimize storage and retrieval costs. Split data into smaller partitions based on relevant attributes (time, vehicle ID). Compress data before storage. Use AWS Glue or Amazon Redshift for data partitioning.
outcome: Reduced query costs through data partitioning and compression

title_full: CMOBCOST01-BP03 Choose the right services by evaluating storage characteristics and requirements
title: Choose the right services by evaluating storage characteristics and requirements
description: Evaluate velocity, volume, and data retention/transfer costs when selecting storage services. For short-living time series data, consider Amazon Timestream. For varying data loads, use Aurora or Redshift. For lower-scale data, use DynamoDB or Aurora. Implement data lifecycle policies.
outcome: Cost-optimized storage through purpose-built database selection

title_full: CMOBCOST01-BP04 Sanitize your data and ensure only essential data is transferred to the cloud
title: Sanitize your data and ensure only essential data is transferred to the cloud
description: Process data at edge as much as possible. Implement edge analytics and decision making with Lambda@Edge. Prioritize critical data for immediate transmission and queue less time-sensitive data. Implement data filtering and pre-processing at the vehicle's onboard systems. Aggregate data locally and apply compression techniques. Use cost calculators to model different approaches.
outcome: Reduced data transfer costs through edge processing and intelligent prioritization

title_full: CMOBCOST02-BP01 Compress and aggregate data to reduce network transmission
title: Compress and aggregate data to reduce network transmission
description: Implement data filtering and aggregation logic at the edge using AWS IoT Core rules engine. Combine measurements into single messages for better compression efficiency. Use AWS IoT Greengrass v2 components for aggregation functions. Apply gzip compression to reduce data size significantly.
outcome: Minimized network costs through data aggregation and compression

title_full: CMOBCOST03-BP01 Analyze data volume and evaluate processing needs to save on computation costs
title: Analyze data volume and evaluate processing needs to save on computation costs
description: Implement serverless computing with Lambda to minimize infrastructure costs. Use serverless functions for real-time aggregation, stream processing with Kinesis, data validation, and real-time score calculation. Implement storage lifecycle policies and use S3 Intelligent-Tiering. Define data archiving policies to move less frequently accessed data to cost-effective tiers.
outcome: Optimized computation costs through serverless architecture and lifecycle policies

title_full: CMOBCOST03-BP02 Use data analytics to analyze vehicular data and develop new services with minimum investment
title: Use data analytics to analyze vehicular data and develop new services with minimum investment
description: Implement data filtering and prioritization at edge, optimize data transmission protocols (MQTT), use compression techniques, optimize telemetry update frequency, and implement data retention policies to manage storage costs.
outcome: Cost-effective data analytics enabling new services without significant investment

title_full: CMOBCOST03-BP03 Integrate with existing infrastructure cost efficiently
title: Integrate with existing infrastructure cost efficiently
description: Use standard APIs and protocols (RESTful, MQTT, OPC UA). Implement edge computing for local processing. Use data transformation layers with Lambda. Leverage message brokers like Kafka or MSK. Use standard data formats (JSON, XML). Use managed services, implement automatic scaling, consider Reserved Instances or Savings Plans, and use AWS cost management tools.
outcome: Cost-efficient integration with existing infrastructure using standard protocols

title_full: CMOBCOST04-BP01 Implement event driven architectures for backend systems
title: Implement event driven architectures for backend systems
description: Use EventBridge or MSK for event bus, Lambda or Fargate for event processing, and Step Functions for orchestration. Consume resources only when events occur. Use Lambda for short-lived async processing, containers (EKS/ECS with Fargate) for near real-time processing of large-scale events, EC2 Spot Instances for non-critical workloads, and AWS Batch for large batch processing.
outcome: Cost-optimized event-driven architecture consuming resources only when needed

title_full: CMOBCOST05-BP01 Define and implement an organizational tagging strategy
title: Define and implement an organizational tagging strategy
description: Engage stakeholders to define tagging use cases, required versus optional tags, enforcement methods, and ownership. Publish common naming schema with conventions. Implement tagging for manually managed resources using AWS Config, and for IaC using CloudFormation tag properties and Hooks. Enforce tagging using tagging policies and SCPs in combination.
outcome: Accurate cost allocation through comprehensive tagging strategy

title_full: CMOBCOST06-BP01 Dynamically adjust payload capacity to accommodate changing conditions
title: Dynamically adjust payload capacity to accommodate changing conditions
description: Implement dynamic payload adjustment based on network conditions and available bandwidth. Adaptively vary payload size based on real-time network conditions to optimize for cost and performance. Prioritize critical or safety-related data while sending less time-sensitive data during off-peak times or in batches.
outcome: Optimized data transfer costs through dynamic payload adjustment

title: Implement a monitoring strategy
description: Continually monitor and analyze usage patterns, network traffic, and associated costs. Define key cost metrics (data transmission, edge processing, cloud storage). Set budgets and alarms. Regularly review cost reports. Optimize resource usage with Trusted Advisor. Implement cost-effective data management practices. Track and optimize data transmission costs through aggregation, compression, and prioritization.
outcome: Proactive cost optimization through continuous monitoring and analysis
